page.title: 15SHUCKNALL COURT
page.content: { Shucknall Court,}owned by Mr.Moore since 1905, is 200 years old. The land amounts to 250 acres of which 70 acres are orchards.{Cider apples}are grown, varieties include the French Michelin, Dabinett, the English Brown Snout and Bulmers Norman. Spraying, grass cutting, apple picking, and apple shaking machines are used on the farm. Rabbit-proof fences surrounding the orchard are effective. The apples need cross pollenators and insecticides are also necessary. Tractors with trailers transport the apples (which sell at Â£82.50 per ton) to{Bulmers}in Hereford. The farm employs 2 full time day workers, working an 8 to 10 hour day. The busiest time in the year is the Autumn, when the apples are harvested. 50 trees may be planted to replace those that have died this year.
